history.text: Hi there! What are your thoughts on The Notebook?
I don't normally go for romances, but I'm a big fan of James Garner. He really made it feel less like a romance more... I dunno, more interesting though.
What do you think of it?

I agree. He reminds me of my grandfather, and my grandmother died of Alzheimer's so that move is really hard for me to watch. I thought the reviews were interesting. I didn't think of it as sappy, more sad. It's strange to me that the reviewers did.
Sorry about your grandmother. Reviewers can get it wrong, sometimes. It didn't feel like a '40's film, makes me wonder how much of this was in Garner's head.
Yeah, it didn't seem like it was set that far back to me either. I love Ryan Gosling and Rachel McAdams, though!
And thank you!
I had forgotten than James Marsden was in it. Did he play her husband?
Or fiance, whichever it was
They act well together, it makes me happy seeing them on the big screen. James Marsden, I think he was the fiance yes. The missus is a big fan of him, ever since Buffy lol
I've never seen Buffy! I didn't realize he was in that.
I believe he played Spike, a vampire and main love interest of the vampire hunter. ^^
Might have been a different guy though.
Ah gotcha. That show was out when I was pretty young, so I only know it by reference.
Fair enough. I've only caught bits and pieces, I've only really paid attention to Joss Whedon's later stuff... Dr Horrible's Sing Along Blog had me dying, I swear.

Yeah, I'm more of a sci-fi person, too. I'm not a big fan of any of the Nicholas Sparks movies because of that. While I didn't find The Notebook to be sappy (probably because of personal stuff), I can't stand the rest of his movies.
Well, movies based on his books anyway
I can agree there. Sci-fi is good for me, even if hollywood doesn't seem to big on it. I haven't read much of Nicholas Spark's books, been meaning to read the Notebook though, just for reference.
Ah, they updated the page. I didn't realize it was set in South Carolina!
I read Charleston and thought West Virginia, that's news to me. Hmm... Yep, definitely the fiance, he caught her kissing Marsden
I knew southeastern US because of the accents, but didn't pay much attention to that detail.
The accents should have been a dead giveaway, I never really thought about it. ^^
I can't imagine this movie without them. I'm from the Midwest and I don't think the star-crossed lovers has the same effect with our nasal accents
I've traveled a little bit, but I'm more south-west. That Annie, she was a mean one, huh?
They wrote her perfectly. A character you love to hate is the best!
You aren't wrong, and Joan Allen nailed that role!
Yes! She was the perfect choice for that character
I can't imagine any other actress quite pulling it off.
They really did a great job casting the whole thing. I totally believed that James Garner was Noah (once you figured that part out lol)
lol Yeah, at first glance I might have thought Lon but... that wouldn't make sense once you get further into the film. All in all, I feel 5.7/10 wasn't a far review. I'd have said at least an 8.0

Agreed. It definitely wasn't the greatest movie I've ever seen, but that's a pretty low score. I'm sure it was another one of those movies where the critics bashed it because it wasn't serious enough.
Sounds just about right. Well, it was great meeting you!

uid1response.feedback: I might actually watch this movie, however, as it seems interesting now.
